channel.title: Linux on Entroware Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Linux on Entroware Documentation

item.title: Configure docker for NVIDIA acceleration
item.description: This guide will show you how to configure your docker environment to make the most of your NVIDIA hardware for GPU accelerated containers, using the NVIDIA Container Toolkit

item.title: Install Tensorflow on Ubuntu
item.description: This guide will walk you through how to install Tensorflow on Ubuntu and configure it for NVIDIA acceleration

item.title: Install Docker on Ubuntu
item.description: This guide will walk you through how to install Docker on Ubuntu without needing the sudo command to run it.

item.title: Create and use a Memtest86 USB Drive in Ubuntu
item.description: This article explains how to create a memtest86 bootable USB drive in Ubuntu and boot into it to test the integrity of the memory in your system.

item.title: Bash Programming Basics
item.description: This article provides an overview of Bash scripting basics, covering essential concepts and commands to get started with writing scripts in the Bash shell.

item.title: Configuring Network Settings in Ubuntu Server: Basics and Troubleshooting
item.description: This article provides a guide to configuring network settings in Ubuntu Server, covering basic configuration tasks such as setting up IP addresses, DNS, and network interfaces, as well as troubleshooting steps for resolving common networking problems.

item.title: Linux Command Line Cheat Sheet
item.description: This cheat sheet provides a quick reference for essential Linux command line commands, covering basic operations for file management, navigation, system administration, and more.

item.title: Managing Scheduled Tasks with Systemd Timers in Linux
item.description: This guide provides an in-depth exploration of systemd timers, offering detailed insights into their syntax, creation, management, and troubleshooting processes, empowering users to optimize task scheduling in Linux environments.

item.title: Managing Users and Groups in Linux
item.description: This guide provides an overview of user and group management in Linux, covering user and group creation, modification, and deletion.

item.title: The Linux Command Line For Beginners
item.description: This article provides a comprehensive introduction to the Linux command line interface (CLI) for beginners, covering essential commands and concepts to navigate and manipulate files and directories.

item.title: Understanding Linux File Permissions and Numeric Representation
item.description: This article simplifies Linux file permissions by explaining the symbolic representation and numeric representation, illustrating how numeric values correlate with read, write, and execute permissions for users, groups, and others.

item.title: Understanding the Linux Filesystem Hierarchy
item.description: This article explains the Linux Filesystem Hierarchy Standard (FHS) which defines the structure and organisation of directories in Linux systems, providing insights into the purpose of each directory.

item.title: Using Cron in Linux: Scheduling Tasks (deprecated)
item.description: This article provides a comprehensive guide to using cron, the time-based job scheduler in Linux, covering basic cron syntax, scheduling tasks, managing cron jobs, and troubleshooting common issues.
